page.title: 06FEELINGS
page.content: Today I feel a quiet contentment as I walk across the lane ,to summer fragrances, under the majestic oaks, which guard my realm. The Honeysuckle and Wildroses drape the hedgerows,pointed with Foxgloves.Their colour emphasizing the starkness of the stubbled fields, which gave their harvest to the new barn. This year the haymaking has been condensed into one busy week, due to the "daggoldi" weather. Now my husband can supplement our income in his building trade. The house stands, within it's walled garden, adjoining the farm buildings, the heart of the holding. In the "Twin Trees" field the sheep graze quietly. With our sheepdog,at heel, I get the corn from the old dairy, to feed the hens,ducks and geese. {I love this way of life.}
